posts.content:
Hi guys, I've just managed to find an mostly complete Walkthrough interior and was wanting to know what year it might be, we've been looking for ages for one to go into our LHD 67 and hadn't come across a couple of details that this one has.

Firstly the cooker unit has a solid panel instead of the larger door and then the rear unit has a lift up panel instead of two hinged doors at the rear. Any ideas cheers Kevin

This should help you with the cooker identification:

viewtopic.php?f=46&t=83551&start=15

Particularly this photo showing the two different splitscreen Spaceway cooker cupboard types:



And you can also see Brian's (BJ1) photos on installing it into a LHD bus.

Brian suggests maybe it's an earlier model, which perhaps is the case but I'd not have thought it was earlier than '66 because the plastic handles only started in 66 in the other Devon interiors I've seen? Can't be sure though.

The rear 'drawer' unit looks right to me too. The left hand side 'drawer' is for the spare wheel which is why the two sides are different sizes and have different opening methods - the wardrobe covers the original walk-through spare wheel well on the left rear of the parcel shelf so it had to be re-located:







etc

Thanks for the information, the previous owner wasn't sure if it was original to their bus, but there's was a D reg, so presumably a 66, so it looks as though it may have been original? Just a couple other questions, would this year have had an overhead table slot? As there wasn't one with the parts we bought. Also on your photo showing the spare tyre, I can see a piece of timber with the a chrome screw to the left of the wardrobe, is that just a flat panel, or is there something else there?

The interior I had didn't have an overhead table holder no. The point of the overhead holder is to hold the larger table that makes the bed on a bulkhead model. A Spaceway uses the smaller table in the bed set-up so no need for the other table.

I think the Torvette had an overhead locker (with the same rear wardrobe and cupboard setup as the Spaceway) but I've not seen one on a Spaceway. Here's a Torvette one:



You can see the over-centre clasp that holds the wardrobe door up is mounted further forward on the Torvette to clear the overhead locker. On your Spaceway you'll probably find that the clasp is in the middle of the wardrobe door:



The panel down the side behind / beside the wardrobe you can also see on this photo and yes it is just a plain wooden panel, with a cutout that matches the one on the rear edge of the opposing cutlery locker. You can see the piece of wood is the middle one on this photo and that the cutout matches the cutlery locker to the left of it, or at least they would once installed with their tops at the same height:



Hope that helps.

Stick up any more photos of what you've got, always nice to have a perv.

This Spaceway shows an overhead locker but it doesn't look to the same specification as a normal Devon cupboard (no black formica, door not recessed) so perhaps not original:

viewtopic.php?f=51&t=108071

Cheers for the update, I'm just trying to piece it all together to see what we have. Just realised we gave the flat panel to the left of the wardrobe, so it's starting to make some sense, but looks like we need to make or find a water tank then?! with pump etc.! I'll try and put some pics up tomorrow in the daylight.

You are in luck, it looks like you need the earlier style tap for your cooker, and after months of there not being any for sale, three have come up on ebay in the last week.

Looks like this:




This one sold last week:
http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/VINTAGE-WHALE ... 1688380604

And these two have been listed in the last few days:
http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/121584013556? ... EBIDX%3AIT
http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/111611855922? ... EBIDX%3AIT

Cheers for the eBay heads up, How were you supposed to drain the water tank, if it was permanently fixed behind the front and rear panelling? My unit has had the tank removed, so the rear panelling is missing!

You were not! The tank would have been for washing only...drinking water via plastic container.
Later bay tanks were plastic...
I have a plastic tank BTW. ..If the size is correct will be available/yours.. anyone confirm what size this should be...?
Nice interior....
Have you bought?
Been asleep..

That makes more sense now cheers! Just picked it up on Sunday, pretty much complete, minus the table, but we have the easicool and it's steel and aluminium outer casing with the drain hole and the sliding plywood seat and the complete rear setup/cupboards etc.. Our bus is LHD, so the plan was to convert this, but after a year of looking, it seems sacrilege to modify this set to make it fit, as it's in pretty good condition!! Now not sure whether to use this as a template to build a new mirrored LHD version and ultimately sell this on to someone with a RHD! I need to have a look on the weekend and decide what to do!
Here's a few shots of what we've got as promised, there is also the Easicool which needs a new door, but it is complete and still has it's badge

^^^ that's my van!, and cooker/tap!

More ref pics on my signature below..

big_al wrote:


^^^ that's my van!, and cooker/tap!

More ref pics on my signature below..


Sorry, I'm a serial picture thief! I browsed a few other of your photos when I was researching my answer, awesome van and a super reference interior for the year too.

I seem to remember you've changed the engine lid now?!
